answers.b: Decrease in enthalpy of the system
answers.c: Increase in enthalpy of the system

explanations.a: Cooling may be observed externally but not always a defining feature.
explanations.b: Correct. Adsorption is exothermic, so enthalpy decreases.

questions.question: The colouring matter which gets adsorbed on activated charcoal is called...

explanations.a: Correct. Adsorbate is the substance being adsorbed.
explanations.b: Adsorber is not a standard term in this context.
explanations.d: Adsorbent is the surface on which adsorption happens.

questions.question: Heat evolved per mole during chemisorption is in the order...

explanations.a: Too broad and not representative of chemisorption specifically.
explanations.b: This range is too low for chemisorption; more typical of physisorption.
explanations.c: Correct. Chemisorption has high heat of adsorption.
